para.text: The following types of source file are associated with the
format. The actual files created will depend on the contents of your package.

li.text: PAX -- the master file for the package.
CLS -- one for each class in the package.
in the package. These globals can be represented accurately as text.
-- one for each of the other globals in the package. These files contain binary representations of the global objects using Dolphin
VU -- one for each of the view
. These files contain binary representations of the package's views, once again in STB format.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: These files are suitable for checking into a

such as Microsoft SourceSafe or WinCVS. Dolphin always attempts to write the contents of these files in a fixed order so that, should it be necessary to merge simultaneous changes made by two different developers, then the change control system tools will be able to do so successfully.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:14px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Once PAX format has been turned on, you will find that when you save your package using the the
menu commands Dolphin saves all of the above files together with the original
